data.title: Starport frigates clock at the border of the map instead of exiting
data.body:
Can be observed in @SoScared's stream: https://youtu.be/VfoRznIOAKI?t=43m13s I don't know the map so I can't exclude a border error in the map definition. This is also not good performance wise, because the delivery actors are never cleaned up.

data.title: Upgradable Mobile and replace IDisableMove
data.body:
Upgradable `Mobile` and replace `IDisableMove` as I mentioned in #9435 a [few hours ago](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/9435#issuecomment-143301169).

Also provides upgrades while loading cargo and carry-all pickup.
Upgrade while loading cargo could be used for cargo loading overlays.

Fixes #9864.

data.title: Rewrite BlowfishKeyProvider.ProcessPredata using safe code.
data.body:
Fixes #2441.  This error would occur when the memory
regions were allocated at particular addresses when
running a mono-compiled binary on a .net runtime.

The data would be copied to the pointer returned
from a fixed() statement, but the managed array
would _not_ be updated with the new data.  This
caused DecryptKey to silently return a bogus key
full of zeros, and the mix file header decryption
would subsequently fail.

data.title: Investigate replacing WithWall- and WithTurretedSpriteBody with *Animation traits
data.body:
I believe issues like #9428 might actually be easier to fix if these two were `With*Animation` traits that modify the sequence, rather than `With*Body` traits (similar to `WithSiloAnimation`).

Additionally, the trait names would become more consistent and less ambigous (if we renamed `WithTurret` to `WithTurretOverlay` at the same time, we'd have `WithTurretAnimation` and `WithTurretOverlay`, perfectly in line with our render trait naming convention).

Of course it would be better to do that before the next release, otherwise modders would (rightfully, in this case) complain about changing this stuff every release.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/26953339-investigate-replacing-withwall-and-withturretedspritebody-with-animation-traits?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Create disable movement trait
data.body:
This trait is a clone of the `DisableUpgrade` trait, the only difference is that it only disables movement. It's needed for units that transform into static variants using deploy to upgrade, as those depend on the "disableupgrade" trait to keep them from moving, that obviously makes them unable to fire.
![deploytoupgrade](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11763228/10106311/536d8274-638a-11e5-90d0-3f5fc7ffcc26.gif)
This image is just a test, where I changed the EMP upgrade for this new one.
![titan](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11763228/10106314/559a47ee-638a-11e5-88f6-61748bd452ad.gif)

data.title: How to compile for Linux?
data.body:
Hello,

With OpenRA-release-20150919, I do:
$ make dependencies
Fetching StyleCopPlus from NuGet
Fetching StyleCop files from NuGet
Fetching ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib from NuGet
Fetching MaxMind.GeoIP2 from NuGet
Fetching SharpFont from NuGet
Fetching NUnit from NuGet
Fetching Mono.Nat from NuGet
Fetching FuzzyLogicLibrary from NuGet.
Fetching SDL2-CS from GitHub.
Fetching Eluant from GitHub.
Detected Lua 5.1 library at /usr/lib/liblua.so.5.1.5
Eluant.dll.config has been created successfully.
Updating GeoIP country database from MaxMind.
$ make all
CSC fixheader.exe
make: dmcs: Command not found
make: **\* [fixheader.exe] Error 127

I am following the instructions from the "INSTALL.md" file in the "Linux" section.

What am I doing wrong please?
A missing requirement?

Thank you.
Best regards.

OS: Slackware 14.1
Kernel: Linux 3.18.20

data.title: AI Hind instantly spotting enemy cammo. pillbox
data.body:
(Release: 20150919)
In the attached replay at ~4:41min you can see an AI Hind instantly attack a cammo. pillbox that has not attacked yet.

http://www.megafileupload.com/5cbi/AIdetectingSpies.orarep

data.title: AI detecting/attacking disguised spies without apparent reason
data.body:
(Release 20150919)
In the attached replay you can see the AI attack disguised spies although there are no "detectors" present. It happens after the same spies have been around for a while, so it seems a bit random. (Maybe it has something to do with spies avoidning getting accidently run over?)

It happens 2 times in the replay: 
at ~12 minutes in the blue AI's base in the northern ore field 
and at ~22 minutes in the same base at the northern ore factory. 

It also seems that revealing one spy reveals all others in the vicinity as well.
http://www.megafileupload.com/5cbi/AIdetectingSpies.orarep

data.title: New stance: HoldPosition+Fire
data.body:
(OpenRA)
Many times you want your troopers to not move and still be able to fire (without being fired at first 'ReturnFire')

But there is no such stance right?

'Defend' stance chases after enemies if im not totally mistaken.

I see much strategical depth in this stance, where usually the other stances fail at doing so because they have a free will to move without being told so and dying.

data.title: TS component towers are broken
data.body:
Astor reported 2 issues with the TS component towers (discovered in his own mod):
As it turns out, 3 weeks ago 21186c10b6a37b72402229ca0ac03444eea27dd3 broke the component tower's make animation (possibly for other structures as well).
And 9da56f51e21064088f29e14d90839c27e10f240a broke their firing.

I was unable to find any other broken actors.

data.title: "Enable Pixel Doubling" on small 4k monitor isn't enough...
data.body:
Tested with Release 20150919 on linux

I'm using a 28" 4k monitor. The units are really small. Even with enabled pixel doubling. Would be nice if this option would be replaced by a "Zoom" (none, 2x, 3x, 4x) option or possibility to use the mouse wheel to zoom during the game.

By the way: The build menu on top right isn't affected by pixel doubling :-(

data.title: Add "mutators" (minichanges) to the game.
data.body:
The CnCNet-based clients are famous for having plenty checkboxes for game modes - e.g. http://media.moddb.com/images/mods/1/11/10865/go.png - which are implemented as small ini chunks read between global rules and map rules (or maybe after map rules, notsure on this part). This is really nice from a logic POV as it implies the game settings being absolutely flexible but clutters the UI and doesn't scale well when it comes to multiple mods.

A better implementation would be what UT2004 did - http://i330.photobucket.com/albums/l422/kassulke29/ScreenShot001.jpg - , having a fifth tab in the lobby screen where players could enable/disable these mutators instead of having dozens of checkboxes.

Settings like destructible bridges or harvester immunity would be a great example to be restored this way. Probably this would need mod-specific saved settings though.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/26915249-add-mutators-minichanges-to-the-game?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

Maybe the inflicted damage should be different for the both have `Health` case; I averaged current and max HP of each as rough structural strength based damage values.

data.title: Move SpawnActorOnDeath to OpenRA.Mods.Common
data.body:
Move `SpawnActorOnDeath` to `OpenRA.Mods.Common` & fix spawned death actor teleportation.
Requires #9414 since loading turret facing(s) would require an ugly hack that would need to be replaced anyways.

Closes #9349.

data.title: Support loading multiple turret facings
data.body:
Adds `TurretFacingsInit` to support loading/saving the turret facing of each turret.
Moved `TurretFacingInit` since it should have been in `OpenRA.Mods.Common/Traits/Turreted.cs` all along.
Added `IActorInitializer` so that `Turreted.TurretFacingsInit` can use `ActorPreviewInitializer`s instead of `ActorInitializer`s when called from `RenderPreview*`.

data.title: Support "destructible" terrain (D2k style)
data.body:
Concrete in Dune 2000 is apparently destructible. As you can see [here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6aOen-y6K1g&feature=youtu.be&t=955). That used to be a 3x3 concrete slab just a couple of minutes earlier.
I don't know what are the specific conditions to destroy concrete in D2k, but I suppose it would be pretty easy for whoever decides to do this to ask on [the FED2k forums](http://forum.dune2k.com) and get a quick answer.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/26882693-support-destructible-terrain-d2k-style?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>
